KA.AQWE.content: Enlightenment (Aufklärung) is man’s exit (Ausgang) from his self-incurred minority (Unmündigkeit), freed from alien guidance (fremder Leitung) > but it is so comfortable to a minor: pay others to do the job for me, guardians will take care of knowledge > the “fair sex” has always found it difficult to become enlightened [laziness, comfort, misogyny?]

KA.AQWE.content: Kant against the program: guardians keeping man from other further enlightenment
guardians as crime against human nature, man is made to progress toward enlightenment [telos]

KA.AQWE.content: men raise (arbeiten) themselves out of backwardness (Rohigkeit) [progression] > enlightenment: man’s release from self-incurred minority, primarily in matters of religion > a ruler knows there is no public danger to permit public use of reason to critique legislation > he who has a well-disciplined army, should not fear these specters (Schatten) of reason: argue as much as you want and about whatever you want but obey! [freedom of spirit of people w/ impassable limits] > NATURE has cherished the germ (Keim) of the inclination and need for free thought: man has dignity (Würde) more than a machine

KA.IUHCI.content: history tells the phenomenal appearances of the will (determined by laws of nature) > man unintentionally promotes an end of nature unknown to him (in his own inclinations)

KA.IUHCI.content: philosophers must presume man’s own purpose (Absicht), so it is up to the philosopher to discover an end of nature in senseless march of human events > Kant will become the scientist of human history [?]

KA.IUHCI.content: man transmits enlightenment to next generation: push genus of man to level appropriate to purpose of nature > otherwise natural faculties would be largely pointless & vain [is this an argument?]

KA.IUHCI.content: nature intends man beyond nature: nature does not do things superfluously > nature has give man the capacity not to follow inclination or instinct but to produce it out of himself [is this a paradox?] > man’s kindness of will achieved by man’s own work > “nature intended that man should owe it all to himself”

KA.IUHCI.content: it is as if Nature is more concerned with man’s rational self-esteem (vernünftige Selbstschätzung), than w/ his well-being: man alone should take credit for his enlightenment > nature planned the toil of earlier generations: antagonism is purposeful it leads to law

KA.IUHCI.content: man’s propensity t enter into society is also linked to a resistance (Widerstande) > man has a desire to associate (vergesellschaften) himself w/ other men and to isolate (vereinzelnen) himself: latter resistance, in society, can come in the form of vainglory and ambition [inclination as Hang or Neigung]
